ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about ship operations, MoBoards, and the Rules of the Road.

I learned about principles in naval warfare and professional knowledge integral to a naval officer's duties. These included navigational fundamentals, weapons systems, organizational frameworks, naval history, electrical and mechanical-related knowledge.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: flexible schedule, quiz retakes
Weaknesses: too early, very long sessions

The strengths of the course were the instructor's excellence and knowledge for surface warfare fundamentals. The learning resources and powerpoints were very comprehensive. Midshipmen knew what to study for on exams and expectations were clear. Diversity of assignments like rules of the road and moboard created dynamism which contributed to a very enjoyable classroom experience in Naval ROTC.
The powerpoints were long and a lot of the information inapplicable to the class so I appreciated that a lot of the information was taken out and class presentations were done instead.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only if they need it for NROTC
